Package cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.solver

Solvers are classes used to run apply one or more algorithms to one or more problems.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Solver Base of all solvers, defines methods required for solver to be used in JCOP.
 

Class Summary
AlgorithmCompareSolver Compares several algorithms against one problem.
AlgorithmCompareSolverTest Tests proper behavior of AlgorithmCompareSolver solver.
BaseSolver Implements some methods commonly used in solvers.
MedianSolver Median solver takes another solver, runs it repeatedly and then returns median of result entries of original solver.
MultiSolver Multiple solver is used to run several algorithms each on several problems.
ProblemCompareSolver Compares several problems with one algorithm.
SimpleSolver Basic solver, applying one algorithm on one problem until one condition is met, algorithm cannot continue or exception is raised.
SimpleSolverTest Tests proper behavior of SimpleSolver solver.
 

Package cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.solver Description

Solvers are classes used to run apply one or more algorithms to one or more problems. Solver is responsible for initialization of problems and algorithms, for setting stop conditions and applying algorithms to problems until some condition is met.
